chariot 0.3.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Join For Ancestor Ids

Source: R/x_join_for.R
join_for_ancestor_ids.Rd

`join_for_*` functions differ from `join_on_*` functions in that `join_for_*` joins on a vocabulary table field that is already specified, and that the join is to add a specific field to the data, this case being the `ancestor_concept_id` field with a join on the `descendant_concept_id` field.

join_for_ancestor_ids(
  kind = c("LEFT", "RIGHT", "INNER", "FULL"),
  data,
  descendant_id_column = NULL,
  select_data_columns = "*",
  distinct = FALSE,
  write_schema = "patelm9",
  vocab_schema = "omop_vocabulary",
  where_in_concept_ancestor_field,
  where_in_concept_ancestor_field_value,
  where_not_in_concept_ancestor_field,
  where_not_in_concept_ancestor_field_value,
  where_is_null_concept_ancestor_field,
  where_is_not_null_concept_ancestor_field,
  case_insensitive = TRUE,
  conn,
  conn_fun = "connectAthena()",
  verbose = TRUE,
  render_sql = TRUE,
  render_only = FALSE
)

Examples

library(chariot)
library(tidyverse)


test_data <-
        queryAthena(sql_statement =     "
                                        SELECT
                                                concept_id AS test_concept_id,
                                                concept_name AS test_concept_name,
                                                concept_code AS test_concept_code
                                        FROM omop_vocabulary.concept
                                        ORDER BY RANDOM()
                                        LIMIT 20;")

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:14]	Loading Cache...
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:14]	Cached SQL: 
#>                                         SELECT
#>                                                 concept_id AS test_concept_id,
#>                                                 concept_name AS test_concept_name,
#>                                                 concept_code AS test_concept_code
#>                                         FROM omop_vocabulary.concept
#>                                         ORDER BY RANDOM()
#>                                         LIMIT 20;
#> Error in lowLevelLoadCache(query = sql_statement): could not find function "lowLevelLoadCache"
test_data

#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'test_data' not found


# `Join On` functions point to the true column that is being joined on
join_on_concept_id(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_id"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:14]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:14]	Dropping patelm9.V20210101163114...

        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name"
)

# Reconfigure the kind of join
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        kind = "INNER"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Dropping patelm9.V20210101163115...
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15] 	
#> ✓ Open connection

#> ✓ JDBC connection

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Dropping patelm9.V20210101163115...complete
#> Error in nrow(data): object 'test_data' not found
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Postgres connection was already closed

# Return only distinct rows
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        kind = "INNER",
        distinct = TRUE
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Dropping patelm9.V20210101163115...
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15] 	
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]

# Return only the `test_concept_code` column
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        kind = "INNER",
        distinct = TRUE,
        select_data_columns = "test_concept_name"
)

# Filter can be applied to the vocabulary tables
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        where_not_in_concept_synonym_field = "language_concept_id",
        where_not_in_concept_synonym_field_value = 4180186
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Dropping patelm9.V20210101163115...
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15] 	
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15] 	
#> ✓ JDBC connection

# `Join For` functions join on a predetermined vocabulary field for the addition
# of the specified column in the source data

# Get all the synonyms for a concept by concept_id
join_for_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        concept_id_column = "test_concept_id"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Dropping patelm9.V20210101163115...
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15] 	
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15] 	
#> ✓ JDBC connection

#> Error in nrow(data): object 'test_data' not found
#> [2021-01-01 16:31:15]	Postgres connection was already closed


# Get the descendant concept ids
join_for_descendant_ids(
        data = test_data,
        ancestor_id_column = "test_concept_id"
        )

# To retrieve all the attributes for either the ancestor or descendants, use
# the following functions

        data = test_data,
        ancestor_id_column = "test_concept_id"
)

        descendant_id_column = "test_concept_id"
